unnormalised: New AIIMS study finds that the standard dosage of paracetamol i.e., 500 mg, is often insufficient for patients weighing over 70 kg. In fact, the research team suggested that for individuals over 70 kg, a dosage of 650mg-750mg might be more effective in managing fever and pain. The study also highlights that while the standard dosage works well for those under 60 kg, a one-size-fits-all approach might not be ideal.
normalised: New A-I-I-M-S study finds that the standard dosage of paracetamol i.e., five hundred milligram, is often insufficient for patients weighing over seventy kilogram. In fact, the research team suggested that for individuals over seventy kilogram, a dosage of six hundred and fifty milligram to seven hundred and fifty milligram might be more effective in managing fever and pain. The study also highlights that while the standard dosage works well for those under sixty kilogram, a one-size-fits-all approach might not be ideal.

unnormalised: The research, conducted over 6 months with a sample size of 200 patients, measured the efficacy of different dosages using pain scales and temperature readings. Participants were split into groups receiving 500mg, 650mg, and 750mg, with the results showing a significant difference in pain reduction and fever control in the higher dosage groups for those over 70kg. The study has been published in the Indian Journal of Medical Research.
